intro: Caryocar edule, commonly known as the "Brazil nut tree," is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the family Caryocaraceae and is characterized by its large, compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain the edible seeds, which are the source of the Brazil nut. Its fruit is typically 10–20 cm long and has a distinct, bumpy surface. The plant is also valued for its ecological role in supporting diverse wildlife in the rainforest ecosystem.
